summary:
U.S., China Engage In "Drone War"; Washington Mulls Rules To Ban "Superior" Chinese Drones

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 Source: EurAsian Times

President Joe Biden has proposed cutting China out of the drone supply chain amidst escalating trade tensions, coinciding with Beijing's bans on American companies.

  • The US Department of Commerce is seeking public opinion on risks associated with China and Russia in drone technology.
  • Drones have become significant in modern warfare, with concerns over data security from adversaries.
  • China’s DJI faces scrutiny from the US for allegations of data leakage.
  • Both nations are intensely competing in the military tech domain, particularly with unmanned aerial vehicles.
  • Chinese advancements in drone technology are raising alarms in the US regarding national security.
“China’s development of new unmanned aerial vehicle capabilities for military use is rapidly catching up to the United States’ own advancements in the technology.”

This ongoing conflict over drone technology highlights the broader implications of US-China relations and raises concerns about the future of international trade and technological security.
newTitle: U.S. and China Clash Over Drone Technology Amid Trade Tensions

title: ‘Take Decisions Thinking Your Kids Are Hostages’: Captive’s Kin To Netanyahu As Hamas Releases Video - News18
summary:
‘Take Decisions Thinking Your Kids Are Hostages’: Captive’s Kin To Netanyahu As Hamas Releases Video

Date: January 05, 2025

Source: News18

The family of 19-year-old Liri Albag urged Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and global leaders to consider their own children’s safety when making decisions, following the release of a video by Hamas showing Albag, who has been held in captivity in Gaza since her kidnapping on October 7, 2023.

  • Hamas released a video featuring Liri Albag, appealing for her release.
  • Albag was kidnapped along with six other women conscripts; five remain captive.
  • The family called for decision-makers to act with urgency regarding the hostages.
  • Negotiations for a truce and hostage release are ongoing in Qatar.
  • There is public pressure on Prime Minister Netanyahu to finalize a deal for the hostages' return.
The family stated, “We appeal to the prime minister, world leaders and all decision-makers: it’s time to take decisions as if it were your own children there.”

In conclusion, this appeal reflects the deep emotional impact of the hostage crisis on families and calls for compassionate action from political leaders.
newTitle: Family of Captive Soldier Appeals to Israeli Leaders to Act as If Their Children Are Hostages

  • The couple was in the midst of divorce proceedings at the time of the incident.

title: Groundbreaking research reveals women’s true preferences in sexual attraction - Hindustan Times
summary:
Groundbreaking Research Reveals Women’s True Preferences in Sexual Attraction

Publication Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: HT Lifestyle Desk

This groundbreaking study published in The Journal of Sexual Medicine examines female sexual attraction, revealing a discrepancy between implicit and explicit preferences. It challenges traditional views of sexual orientation by suggesting that women may experience same-sex attraction more frequently than they consciously admit.

Key Points:

  • 80.4% of participants identified as heterosexual.
  • 67.8% displayed implicit gynephilic preferences.
  • Only 5.9% showed implicit androphilic preferences.
“In humans, gynephilia may be the norm,” explained study author Andrea S Camperio Ciani, Professor of Evolutionary Psychology at the University of Padova.

The findings highlight the complex interplay of biological, social, and individual factors in female sexual orientation.
newTitle: Groundbreaking Research Reveals Women’s True Preferences in Sexual Attraction

title: Washington Post cartoonist quits after satire of Jeff Bezos is rejected - Hindustan Times
Pulitzer Winner quits after Jeff Bezos cartoon gets 'killed' at Washington Post: ‘Dangerous for free press’ - Hindustan Times
Pulitzer Winner quits after Jeff Bezos cartoon gets 'Killed' at Washington Post: ‘Dangerous for free press’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pulitzer Winner Resigns After Cartoon Critiquing Jeff Bezos Gets Censored

Date: Jan 05, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Ann Telnaes, a Pulitzer Prize-winning cartoonist, resigned from the Washington Post after her cartoon criticizing tech leaders, including Jeff Bezos, was rejected. The cartoon satirized their flattery towards President-elect Donald Trump.

  • Telnaes submitted a cartoon aimed at notable tech moguls which was ultimately pulled from publication.
  • The cartoon humorously depicted Bezos and others kneeling before a statue of Donald Trump.
  • Telnaes expressed frustration over being unable to address critical issues through her artwork.
  • The incident follows previous controversies regarding editorial decisions at the Washington Post.
“To be clear, there have been instances where sketches have been rejected or revisions requested, but never because of the point of view inherent in the cartoon’s commentary. That’s a gamechanger … and dangerous for a free press.” - Ann Telnaes

The resignation raises concerns about editorial censorship and creative freedom in journalism.
newTitle: Pulitzer Winner Resigns After Cartoon Critiquing Jeff Bezos Gets Censored

title: India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 3: AUS claim BGT after a decade with 6-wicket win, IND out of WTC Final race - Hindustan Times
summary:
India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 3: AUS claim BGT after a decade with 6-wicket win, IND out of WTC Final race

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Australia secured a 6-wicket victory over India, claiming the Border-Gavaskar Trophy for the first time in a decade and eliminating India from the World Test Championship Final race.

  • Australia finished their chase at 162 for 4, having set a target of 162 runs.
  • Prasidh Krishna took 3 wickets early on, but Australia regained control with solid performances from Travis Head and Beau Webster.
  • India was without key bowler Jasprit Bumrah, which hindered their performance.
  • Scott Boland was pivotal, finishing with a 10-wicket haul for the match.
“Unreal. Few of us didn't have. Lived up to all the hype. Just been clear with our plans.” - Pat Cummins

Australia's dominance throughout the series culminated in this match, reflecting their superior performance despite India's efforts.
newTitle: Australia Clinches Border-Gavaskar Trophy with 6-Wicket Win Against India

title: New Zealand announces major changes to visa rules; get all the details here - The Times of India
Egypt, China in big trouble as Israel want to build another Suez Canal for…, it will run from... - India.com
summary:
Israel Proposes Ben Gurion Canal: A New Suez Alternative

Date: Not specified Source: India.com

Amid the ongoing war in Gaza, Israel is preparing to create an alternative to the Suez Canal, named the Ben Gurion Canal, which will connect the Mediterranean Sea to the Arabian Sea.

  • The canal will span approximately 260 to 300 kilometers and includes significant portions running through the Negev Desert and Gaza Strip.
  • This project is seen as a response to the geopolitical battle involving the US and China, particularly in light of the current tensions in Gaza.
  • The construction aims to reduce reliance on the Suez Canal, which has strategic significance for shipping routes.
  • Challenges include substantial costs, potential security threats from nearby hostile factions, and the comprehensive engineering required for nuclear excavation as part of its development.
"The proposed waterway would feature two lanes, each 50 meters deep and 200 meters wide, making it superior in capacity compared to the Suez Canal."

The project, if successful, could provide strategic advantages to both Israel and the US, particularly concerning global shipping and trade routes.
newTitle: Israel Proposes Ben Gurion Canal: A New Suez Alternative

title: Joe Biden honours Hillary Clinton, George Soros, Lionel Messi with Presidential Medal of Freedom - The Hindu
summary:
Joe Biden honours Hillary Clinton, George Soros, Lionel Messi with Presidential Medal of Freedom

Published: January 05, 2025 Source: The Hindu

On January 4, 2025, President Joe Biden presented the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation’s highest civilian honor, to several notable figures including Hillary Clinton and George Soros. The ceremony, held in the East Room of the White House, recognized individuals who have significantly impacted American culture and ideals.

  • President Biden awarded the Medal to 16 individuals, including Hillary Clinton, George Soros, and others.
  • Due to a scheduling conflict, Lionel Messi was not present to receive his award.
  • Biden emphasized the extraordinary contributions of the recipients in shaping American culture and humanitarian efforts.
  • Hillary Clinton received a standing ovation for her extensive contributions to society as a lawyer, First Lady, Senator, and Secretary of State.
  • Posthumous awards were given to notable figures like Fannie Lou Hamer and Robert F. Kennedy.
  • The awarding process faced criticism from Republican leaders who opposed Soros receiving the honor.
“The Presidential Medal of Freedom is awarded to George Soros. Born into a Jewish family in Hungary, George Soros escaped Nazi occupation to build a life of freedom...”

Overall, the event highlighted the importance of recognizing individuals committed to the ideals of freedom and democracy in America, while also sparking significant political controversy regarding some recipients.
newTitle: Joe Biden Honors Notable Figures with Presidential Medal of Freedom

title: 9999 and out: Steven Smith falls one short of landmark 10,000 Test runs - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
9999 and out: Steven Smith falls one short of landmark 10,000 Test runs

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Steven Smith narrowly missed reaching the 10,000-run milestone in Test cricket, falling out at 9999 runs during a match in Sydney. He will have to wait for the upcoming Test against Sri Lanka for another chance at this achievement.

  • Smith edged to slip just five runs short of 10,000 runs on the previous day.
  • During the Pink Test on Jane McGrath Day, he was dismissed at 9999 runs.
  • Smith becomes the second batter in history to fall on 9999 runs, after Mahela Jayawardene.
  • If he reaches 10,000 runs, he will be the 15th player ever to achieve this milestone.
  • Border praised Smith, ranking him alongside Australia’s cricket greats.
  • Smith’s path to the milestone has been delayed after a lean season following Warner’s retirement.
  • He is expected to captain Australia during the Sri Lanka tour.
“Averaging 57 or so is in the top echelon ever… as far as Australia’s concerned, Steve [Smith] ranks equally with that group, no problems whatsoever.” - Allan Border

In conclusion, Smith's journey to 10,000 runs has faced unexpected delays, but his position as one of the top cricketers remains undoubted.
newTitle: Steven Smith Falls Just Short of 10,000 Test Runs

title: Elite League Of Nations! Turkey Launches Construction Of 60,000-Ton MUGEM, The National Aircraft Carrier! - EurAsian Times
summary:
Turkey Begins Construction of 60,000-Ton National Aircraft Carrier MUGEM

Date: October 2023 | Source: EurAsian Times

Turkey has officially commenced the construction of its National Aircraft Carrier (MUGEM), alongside a submarine and a new destroyer. This initiative is part of Turkey's strategy to enhance its defense capabilities and reduce reliance on foreign suppliers.

  • Construction involves three key ships: MUGEM, MILDEN (submarine), and the TF-2000 destroyer.
  • The MUGEM will measure 285 meters in length and will have a displacement of 60,000 tons.
  • It aims to elevate Turkey's military capabilities and project power in the region.
  • Turkey seeks to develop its defense technologies domestically as part of its long-term military objectives.
“Very few nations operate aircraft carriers. A total of 22 aircraft carriers are operational at present, with the US alone accounting for 11.”

This project aligns with Turkey’s broader military goals of self-sufficiency and technological advancement.
newTitle: Turkey Begins Construction of 60,000-Ton National Aircraft Carrier MUGEM

title: Singapore concerned over increasing 'sham marriages' with foreign women - Business Standard
summary:
Singapore concerned over increasing 'sham marriages' with foreign women

Publication Date: 2023

Source: The Straits Times

Singapore authorities are increasingly worried about sham marriages between Singaporean men and foreign women, often involving a syndicate, which may result in social issues.

  • The Immigration and Checkpoints Authority (ICA) reported a rise in sham marriages, with 32 cases between January and September last year, up from four cases during the same period in 2023.
  • These marriages typically involve a scheme where foreign women pay Singaporean men to marry them for immigration privileges.
  • Inspector Mark Chai expressed concern that such marriages could lead to illicit activities in Singapore's multi-ethnic society.
  • Criminal charges for sham marriage involvement can lead to a maximum of 10 years in prison, fines up to SGD10,000, or both.
  • Public tip-offs primarily identify these marriage of convenience cases.
“The couple can try to hide the fact that their union is a marriage of convenience, but there are telltale signs that our officers are able to spot.” - Superintendent Goh Wee Kiat

Authorities are urging the public to report any suspected sham marriages for further investigation.
newTitle: Singapore concerned over increasing 'sham marriages' with foreign women

title: Jimmy Carter's funeral begins by tracing 100 years from rural Georgia to the world stage - CNBC
summary:
Jimmy Carter's Funeral Begins with Tribute to His 100-Year Legacy

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: CNBC

Jimmy Carter’s extended public farewell began Saturday in Georgia, marking the journey of the 39th U.S. president from rural beginnings to global humanitarian efforts. The six-day state funeral honors his long life and significant contributions.

  • His casket was transported through Plains, where he was born and raised, reflecting on his farming roots.
  • Carter served as a state senator and governor of Georgia before his presidency.
  • His funeral includes personalized memorials, highlighting his humanitarian work and political legacy.
  • Family members shared heartfelt stories and memories during the processions.
  • Carter will lie in repose at the Carter Presidential Center before national rites in Washington.
“He was an amazing man. He was held up and propped up and soothed by an amazing woman.” - James Earl “Chip” Carter III

The tribute encapsulates Carter’s profound influence on American politics and his commitment to humanitarian causes, setting a standard for future presidents.
newTitle: Jimmy Carter's Funeral Begins with Tribute to His 100-Year Legacy

title: Rising tensions push Pakistan and Taliban relations to the brink - Deccan Herald
summary:
Rising tensions push Pakistan and Taliban relations to the brink

Published: 04 January 2025, 21:16 IST

Pakistan's relationship with the Taliban has deteriorated significantly over the last three years due to border disputes and the Taliban's inaction against the Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP), resulting in increased violence and strained diplomatic communications.

  • Pakistan has suffered 685 security personnel losses in over 400 terror attacks, marking 2024 as particularly deadly.
  • The Taliban refuses to recognize the Durand Line as the border and characterizes the TTP issue as Pakistan's internal problem.
  • Recent airstrikes by Pakistan targeted TTP hideouts in Afghanistan, leading to civilian casualties, according to reports.
  • Diplomatic dialogues between Pakistan and Taliban officials continue, but the relationship remains tense and unresolved.
  • Regional implications involve Tajikistan's concerns about Taliban security and potential alliances.
  • India is maintaining humanitarian and developmental engagement with Afghanistan despite not recognizing the Taliban government formally.
The Taliban vowed to defend Afghanistan’s independence and sovereignty.

In conclusion, while both parties are attempting to avoid further escalations, unresolved tensions may lead to more conflicts as their strategic interests clash.
newTitle: Rising tensions push Pakistan and Taliban relations to the brink

title: Dangerous storm to unleash snow, ice, bitter cold across US - Hindustan Times
summary:
Dangerous Storm Set to Bring Snow, Ice, and Bitter Cold Across the US

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A colossal winter storm is set to hit the eastern half of the US, plunging more than 55 million people into a deep freeze with heavy snowfall, frigid temperatures, and hazardous travel conditions.

  • Winter storm warnings issued from Montana to Maryland, Delaware, and Virginia.
  • Heavy lake-effect snow expected in New York and Pennsylvania with totals possibly reaching two feet.
  • Blizzard conditions forecast across Central Plains, with travel being extremely hazardous.
  • Temperatures expected to drop below zero Fahrenheit in some areas, compounded by strong winds.
  • Freezing rain and sleet predicted to create treacherous conditions from Kansas to Virginia.
  • State emergencies declared in Missouri and Virginia due to hazardous weather risks.
Governor Andy Beshear stated, "The storm will likely cause significant disruption and dangerous conditions on our roads and could cause significant power outages just 24 hours before it's going to get really cold in Kentucky."

As the storm approaches, residents are urged to prepare for hazardous conditions and potential power outages.
newTitle: Dangerous Storm Set to Bring Snow, Ice, and Bitter Cold Across the US
